content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

For example, for the following input
```jlcon
julia> df = DataFrame(dt=[Date("2018-05-23"), Date("1947-01-26")])
2×1 DataFrames.DataFrame
│ Row │ dt       │
├─────┼──────────┤
│ 1   │ 2018-05-23 │
│ 2   │ 1947-01-26 │
```
the function should produce the following output:
```jlcon
julia> df = add_yearmonth(df)
2×2 DataFrames.DataFrame
│ Row │ dt       │ ym     │
├─────┼──────────┼────────┤
│ 1   │ 2018-05-23 │ 201805 │
│ 2   │ 1947-01-26 │ 194701 │
```
